title: Fix exception handling in _get_host_metrics()

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zhaoqin

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/135322
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=e09880dcd0f7ae766cae170c5b30fbabbe85eac3
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit e09880dcd0f7ae766cae170c5b30fbabbe85eac3
Author: Qin Zhao <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Nov 18 23:15:47 2014 +0800

    Fix exception handling in _get_host_metrics()
    
    In resource_tracker.py, the exception path of _get_host_metrics()
    misspells variable name 'monitor'. When exception occurs, this
    misspelling prevents us to log warning message. This code change
    corrects the misspelling.
    
    Closes-Bug: 1394052
    
    Change-Id: I8a99a4ceb53c89038e8b292a15ad9fd20daa4233
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

Author: Qin Zhao <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Nov 18 23:15:47 2014 +0800

    Fix exception handling in _get_host_metrics()
    
    In resource_tracker.py, the exception path of _get_host_metrics()
    misspells variable name 'monitor'. When exception occurs, this
    misspelling prevents us to log warning message. This code change
    corrects the misspelling.
    
    Closes-Bug: 1394052

            nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py
